@zachleat @bepsays @eleven_ty @Netlify @npmjs And FWIW, unless your dependencies change (or rather, unless your package.json changes) @Netlify will run the build with the same stashed dependencies, not reinstall them each time. But yeah... bracing for a cryptic reminder in 2023: "hold breath and hit deploy"

Replying to @bepsays 2018-07-16 20:10
@bepsays @Netlify @eleven_ty They will be the builds of the latest commit to the specified branch. Unless they are locked. Deploys in @Netlify can be locked too, so commits stop triggering builds.

Replying to @_munter_ 2018-07-06 19:12
@_munter_ @rohan10 @Netlify Netlify uses cloudfront for some of the optimised resources if you turn on the post-processing feature to automatically do some asset squeezing. If your site is a @gatsbyjs build, you get various magical optimisation already, so you'll need to not enable that post-processing.
